derivation: a primitive root; in Ecclesiastes 12:5, by interchange for H5132 (נוּץ), to bloom
outline:
1. to spurn, contemn, despise, abhor
    1. (Qal) to spurn, contemn
    2. (Piel)
      1. to spurn
      2. to cause to contemn
    3. (Hiphil) to spurn
    4. (Hithpolel) to be contemned
kjv_def: abhor, (give occasion to) blaspheme, contemn, despise, flourish, [idiom] great, provoke.
